name: AdvanceDirectivesContentTypes
title: Advance Directives Content Types
description: Types of content that may be found in a person's advance directive document.
purpose: (Clinical Focus: Types of content that may be covered in a person-authored advance directive document.),(Data Element Scope: Types of content that may be covered in a person-authored advance directive document),(Inclusion Criteria: Concepts from LOINC used to identify the care experience and/or treatment intervention preferences and goal/priorities for care that may be covered in a person-authored advance directive document.),(Exclusion Criteria: )

concept.display: Goals, preferences, and priorities for medical treatment [Reported]
Decision to inform doctors and nurses about the role religion, faith, culture, or spirituality play in my life [Reported]
Preference on consulting a supportive and palliative care team to help treat physical, emotional, and spiritual discomfort and support family [Reported]
Information to tell doctors if my health deteriorates due to a terminal illness and I am unable to interact meaningfully with family, friends, or surroundings [Reported]
Information to tell doctors if I have a severe, irreversible brain injury or illness and can't dress, feed, or bathe myself, or communicate my medical wishes, but can be kept alive [Reported]
Preferred location to spend final days if possible to choose [Reported]
Thoughts on organ and tissue donations [Reported]
Advance directive - request for tube feeding
Advance directive - request for life support
Advance directive - request for IV fluid and support
Advance directive - request for resuscitation that differs from cardiopulmonary resuscitation
Other directives that have not otherwise been documented [Reported]
Thoughts on artificial nutrition and hydration [Reported]
Thoughts on IV fluid and support [Reported]
Goals AndOr preferences in order of priority [Reported]
Thoughts on life-sustaining procedures if pregnant [Reported]
Messages to be delivered after death [Reported]
Near death thoughts and feelings to be shared [Reported]
Religious or cultural affiliation contact to notify [Reported]
Goals, preferences, and priorities upon death [Reported]
